file_content.text: Good luck, LT.
Hey there, LT. Sergeant Mathin, reporting for duty with fun toys in tow, sir.
Let's see what you've got for me.
At ease, Sergeant.
You must have really hauled to get here so fast.
Good timing.
What can I say, sir? Garza says run, so I run.
This is serious business, Sergeant.
Don't joke around.
Yes, sir, it is--which is why you need some serious hardware.
First item of business is your detonator, sir: a Czerka Arms 53-R high-yield thermite explosive. Guaranteed to get a party started--or ended.
Thanks, Sergeant.
How far away should I be when this thing detonates?
What's the blast radius?
Well, tempting as it is to watch this thing go off, you'll want to be a good way off when it does, sir.
If this doesn't take the relay down, I won't be pleased, Sergeant.
It better get the job done.
Trust me, sir--nothing to worry about. That bomb is a beast.
Now, the comm relay you're going after is in the Works, an industrial area on the lower levels of Coruscant. It's a dangerous place, LT.
Besides the Imperials you're bound to find, the rogue service droids down there will squash anyone they can get their big metal claws around.
Thanks for the warning, Sergeant.
I'll stay sharp.
Just doing my job, LT.
Service droids don't scare me.
Not a doubt in my mind, sir. Just thought I'd give you the heads-up.
Perfect, just perfect.
Once you've made your way to the relay, plant that detonator on the generator coupling at the center--and clear out of there before it goes off.
That's all there is to it, LT. I won't hold you up any longer. Good luck.
I also have another little present for you, Lieutenant. A nice young lady you might remember, Sergeant Jaxo, asked me to give you this scope for your blaster.
She said she retrofitted it from the prototype blaster that you lifted from the Black Sun hideout. Lucky you.
Be sure to thank Jaxo for me.
Excellent.
You got it, LT.
Jaxo and I have a special thing going, Mathin.
I have a way with the ladies.
That's none of my business, sir.
Us girls have to watch out for each other.
It's good to have friends.
Preferential treatment, huh? You ought to be ashamed.
You can share your witty insights with someone else.
Stow the commentary, Sergeant.
Whatever you say, sir.
Apologies, sir. I just think it's cute, is all.
